reviews.title: Beautiful, but pricey...
reviews.text: We stayed at the Viewfield House two nights of our Scotland trip, planning for it to be the most expensive and nicest of our hotels/b&bs. The house is beautiful, old, historic and the service was very nice. However, the room was a bit uncomfortable. The bed was small (double) and the matress a bit "chunky." The bathroom was acceptible, but the shower/tub was awkward.
Hugh MacDonald, the owner, was nice and greeted the guests every evening in his kilt and engaged all of us in chit-chat. Though it seemed to be a chore for him at times, rather than an enjoyment.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Portree
A Scottish fantasy
reviews.text: The dinner we had at Viewfield House was dissapointing. We had great meals throughout our visit in Scotland and were expecting the same at Viewfield, but it was lacking. Appetizer consisted of Smoked Herring (quite awful) with a main dish of either Pork with Apricot Stuffing or Baked Flounder (which tasted like Salmon). The Pork was tasty but we were given only a few slices and the Flounder was loaded with bones to pick through. Dessert was touted as some sort of Chocolate Cake with cream, but it looked and tasted like a Duncan Hines Brownie sitting in cream.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a lovely few days on the Isle of Skye at the guest house of Hugh MacDonald. We may be the only people to ever attempt to traverse the island using only public transit, but rambling around, enjoying the restaurants, getting lost in a bog, we had an amazing experience. The Isle of Skye is absolutely beautiful, and the guest house -- Viewfield House -- is as well. The room was very comfortable, and you really get the feeling that you're at a house party from an Agatha Christy novel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay on the Isle of Skye

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, Hugh MacDonald was just lovely. He's a pleasant man, excellent, devoted host, and helped my husband tremendously with figuring out the bus schedules, even leaving my husband in charge of the front desk while he ran down to the bus stop to check the schedule for the next day.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

likes.liked: — The charming atmosphere and the great location. Also, the kind staff. Great value for the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this place. My wife and I spent 3 nights there last week, and everything was wonderful. The house and rooms have a kind of faded charm that we enjoyed. It was like living in a museum with all of the artifacts, which were both fascinating and humorous at the same time. The rooms were huge, and the house is an easy 10 minute walk from the center of town. We loved that the house was in such a quiet area. Hugh, the owner is so kind, and the entire staff was wonderful. We would stay there again in the future without hesitating. Portree is also a wonderful base from which to explore beautiful Skye. Don't even think about going for only one night, which a lot of people seem to do.
reviews.title: A real family home
Good B&B
reviews.text: Viewfield House is a family home as well as a guesthouse and one with both a large and evident history and a good host in Hugh MacDonald. The evening meal was good, as was our room and breakfast. Other than the feeling of staying somewhere with true history, the thing we liked was meeting other guests and our host in the pleasant lounge (log fire in August!!)
I stayed here back in April and really enjoyed the experience.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.text: What a fantastic place to stay, Beautiful suroundings total peace and quiet after a very long journey, We used 3 rooms all were very clean and comfortable each with a great view be it over the garden or over the water.Super hospitality, Hugh Macdonald was a splendid hoste as were all his staff, Nothing was to much trouble.We went with all the family old and young and every one loved it ,The food was fresh cooked to perfection.(BLOODY MARVELOUS) The lounge in the evening was full of good conversation and a very warm atmosphere. I could go on forever as you can tell we loved it and will be returning as soon as possible.
reviews.title: Cant Wait to go Back

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Viewfield House once, and it was my first trip to the Highlands, in 1998. Being a genuine Anglophile, and frequent visitor to London, I was anxious to experience Johnson's Highlands. I strongly recommend staying at The Viewfield House. Mr. Hugh MacDonald is stellar! Fine hospitality, Fine food, and a Fine, Fine historic ambiance that is real, not reproduced!! If Johnson was alive today, it'd be his stay of choice! The small castle (as I call it) is wonderfully located within a few minutes walking distance of Portree (I know, because I walked it), yet situated in a beautiful wooded setting that overlooks a portion of the sea on the other side. It is the only place to stay if you're truly wanting the quintessential Scottish experience! I felt as though I had been there many times before. Also, upon my return to London, I realized I had left behind a jacket. Mr. MacDonald graciously offered to mail it to me in London right away, which he did!
reviews.title: Scottish Perfection!

likes.disliked: — You must have the kippers at breakfast!

reviews.text: I have visited Viewfield House twice. I regret it is not more, but I am certain on our next trip to Scotland it will be on our itinerary. Our first trip showed up our shortcomings on estimating driving time in Scotland. We caught the last ferry and arrived at Viewfield House at 1:00 am. Mr. Macdonald was up to greet us. I am in the hospitality business and new this inexcusably late arrival was a real imposition on a family business, but Mr. Macdonald would hear nothing of our apologies, and concerned himself about our comfort.
reviews.title: Above & Beyond!

reviews.text: During this first trip we stayed in the large airy room above the parlor with twin beds. At that time the bathroom was across the hall and we admit to having fun using the thunder bucket toilet. The second trip in the same large room, an in-suite bathroom was attached. It was much more comfortable with a large clawfoot tub, but we had to go check out the thunder bucket toilet! Breakfast was delightful and the conversation was subdued but interesting. It was the first time we tried black pudding! My wife and I are not all that out-going, and we found the low-key polite atmosphere to our liking. Our first trip was for only one night. We tried to cram too much into our vacation. Our second trip was for two nights and we left wishing we had worked a longer stay on the island.
reviews.title: Wonderful victorian familty house - pricy but worth it
Care and Comfort
reviews.text: During our second stay we limped our rental car back to the Inn after damaging a tire on a Skye backroad. Asking about how we could get it repaired, the Macdonalds referred a service that had it repaired and remounted before we could even give it serious thought. Our second night was capped off by a memorable dinner.
